data.title: Rod Stewart shares sweet photo with his sister Mary to celebrate her 95th birthday
data.meta_description: Rod Stewart shares sweet photo with his sister Mary to celebrate her 95th birthday. The singer shared a photo of the pair at The Ritz Hotel in front of a Christmas tree.
data.text:
She joined him on stage earlier this year

'Maggie May' singer Sir Rod Stewart has taken to social media to celebrate his sister Mary's 95th birthday. Mary joined Rod Stewart on stage earlier this year, where the pair duetted on Rod's hit 'Sailing'.

Sharing a photo from Mary's special day on his Instagram Stories, Rod can be seen standing next to his sister, in a festive setting, believed to be The Ritz Hotel.

In a second photo, shared by Rod's wife Penny Lancaster, more of the family can been seen standing next to Mary, in front of a beautiful Christmas tree.

Many fans have been commenting on Penny's photo, with one writing: 'Penny, she does not look 95 ! Such a good looking family :)', with another commenting: 'Mary look absolutely fabulous! Would be delighted to look like her at 80!! Happy birthday Mary ❤️'. (sic)

Proving age is just a number, earlier this year Mary, who was 94 at the time, joined her younger brother Rod on stage in Edinburgh, where they sang his 1975 his 'Sailing'. The pair sang with their arms around each other, much to the delight of fans. Mary was draped in a Royal Banner of Scotland flag and smiling as she joined her brother.

In other news, earlier this month, Rod announced he would be releasing an album with Jools Holland next year called 'Swing Fever'. The pair announced the upcoming album by performing in St Pancras train station, in London, where they wowed fans with their new song 'Almost Like Being In Love', accompanied by a full band.

The album will be released on 23rd February 2024, and is available to pre-order now. The first song from the album called 'Almost Like Being In Love' has also been released.
